Package Attributes

Class AggregatingAttribute

  • java.lang.Object
    • AbstractObjects.ItemWithId
      • Attributes.Attribute
        • Attributes.AggregatingAttribute
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class AggregatingAttribute
extends Attribute
implements java.io.Serializable
    This attribute can aggregate the values of another attribute. Example: the concept peter has an attribute marks, and he has several marks. Now one can define an AggregatingAttribute averageMarks which computes the average of peter's marks. The AggregatingAttribute is specified by providing:
    - an initial object
    - an aggregating function that aggregates the values into the initial object
    - a finalizer that processes the aggregated value in some way.
    The attribute is automatically functional.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        rangeType - the range Type (may be null)
        attribute - whose values are to be aggregated

    • Method Detail

      • setAggregators

        public void setAggregators​(java.io.Serializable startObject,
                           java.lang.String startObjectString,
                           java.util.function.BiFunction<java.lang.Object,DataObject,java.lang.Object> aggregator,
                           java.lang.String aggregatorString,
                           java.util.function.Function<java.lang.Object,DataObject> finalizer,
                           java.lang.String finalizerString)
        sets the objects which are used to aggregate the values. If the attribute is not to be serialized, no textual representations are necessary, They may be null. If the attribute is to be serialized, there are two possibilities:
        1. aggregator and finalizer are Serializable. Then no textual represetnation is necessary.
        2. They are not Serializable. The a textual representation which can be compiled by the Groovy compiler need to be provided.
        Parameters:
        startObject - the initial object for starting the aggregation
        startObjectString - a textual representation of the initial object.
        aggregator - the aggregator for adding new values to the initial object
        aggregatorString - a textual representation of the aggregator
        finalizer - a function for processing the aggregated value in some way
        finalizerString - a textual representation of the finalizer

      • getFirst

        public DataObject getFirst​(Concept concept,
                           Scope scope,
                           Operators operator,
                           DataObject otherValue,
                           java.lang.Object otherConstraints,
                           Context context)
        returns the result of the aggregation (considering constraints if necessary). otherConstraints is either null, an AttributeValueList, or an ArrayList<AttributeValueList> (if the url-Attribute.rel is a ChainAttribute).
        Overrides:
        getFirst in class Attribute
        Parameters:
        concept - the concept for which the attribute value is accessed.
        scope - the scope for the values to be returned.
        operator - for comparing the url-attribute's values with 'otherValue'
        otherValue - to be compared with the url-attribute's values
        otherConstraints - the url-attributes constraints must imply 'otherConstraints'
        context - where the objects live in.
        Returns:
        result of the aggregation.

      • parseString

        public static AggregatingAttribute parseString​(java.lang.String type,
                                               java.lang.String name,
                                               java.lang.String declaration,
                                               java.lang.String namespace,
                                               Context context,
                                               java.lang.StringBuilder errors,
                                               int lineNumber,
                                               DataBlock dataBlock)
        parses an AggregatingAttribute declaration of the form
        [attribute] range = [range] startObject = ... aggregator = ... finalizer = ... "; Note that a Groovy parser is used. therefore the code must be Groovy code. One must use the full package paths in the code.
        Parameters:
        type - must be "AggregatingAttribute"
        name - the applicationName of the attribute
        declaration - the textual declaration of the attribute.
        context - the context into which the string is to be parsed.
        errors - for appending error messages
        dataBlock - the origin of the declaration
        Returns:
        the parsed attribute or null.
